DataElement.preferredName: Sinusoidal Obstruction Syndrome Interventions Requirement Intervention Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question asking to check all the types of interventions were required if any were required during reporting period.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The SOS interventions required for a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by severe hepatic injury as a result of the blood vessels of the liver becoming inflamed and/or blocked.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by severe hepatic injury as a result of the blood vessels of the liver becoming inflamed and/or blocked.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

Concepts.definition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Infusion Method of Administration Fresh Frozen Plasma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Infusion Method of Administration Fresh Frozen Plasma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The technique of administration of a pharmaceutical product, usually slowly and in larger volumes than for an injection, by introducing it into the body, usually after puncturing the skin; it is usually administered intravenously, but occasionally by other routes, e.g. subcutaneously.: The plasma that is separated from the whole blood and frozen quickly after a blood donation in order to be used for blood transfusions.

Concepts.definition: The technique of administration of a pharmaceutical product, usually slowly and in larger volumes than for an injection, by introducing it into the body, usually after puncturing the skin; it is usually administered intravenously, but occasionally by other routes, e.g. subcutaneously.
The plasma that is separated from the whole blood and frozen quickly after a blood donation in order to be used for blood transfusions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.: The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.
The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of separating certain cells from the plasma in the blood by a machine; only the cells are returned to the person. Plasmapheresis can be used to remove excess antibodies from the blood.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that collects plasma from the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of cleansing the blood when the kidneys are not able to filter the blood.

Concepts.definition: A procedure to remove toxic substances from the blood that is used in patients with end-stage chronic kidney disease or acute kidney failure. This includes hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical device that facilitates breathing.: Moral, psychological, physical, or financial aid or assistance; approval.

Concepts.definition: A medical device that facilitates breathing.
Moral, psychological, physical, or financial aid or assistance; approval.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
